contents.contents: Now turn your back on the Collegiate church and take the “Rue Pierre Ythier” on your right, then the “Rue du Palis” on your left. Walk on for a few metres. On your left is the Museum of Provins and its region.
In the museum artefacts that date back to prehistoric days are on display.

question.contents: What makes the museum different from others?
choices: It is one of the oldest houses in the town
It was built in the 13th century
It is inside a house called “the Romane House”
The monks used to live there

explanations.contents: The museum was set up in the Romane House which is also one of the oldest houses in the town of Provins.
